unnormalised: IIT Delhi researchers have achieved a breakthrough in solving complex linear algebra equations. Their novel algorithm reportedly cuts computation time by 15% on average, significantly improving efficiency. The team, led by Dr. Meera Iyer, published their findings in the "Journal of Applied Mathematics".
normalised: I-I-T Delhi researchers have achieved a breakthrough in solving complex linear algebra equations. Their novel algorithm reportedly cuts computation time by fifteen percent on average, significantly improving efficiency. The team, led by Doctor Meera Iyer, published their findings in the "Journal of Applied Mathematics".

unnormalised: The new method focuses on optimizing matrix inversion for matrices larger than 1000x1000. Existing techniques often struggle with such large datasets. Dr. Iyer explained that their approach leverages properties of sparse matrices to reduce the number of floating-point operations required. Initial tests showed a reduction of approximately 0.05 seconds per iteration on a standard benchmark problem.
